funfact 0.300
  • Reference

Generate population for data simulation

gen_pop.Rd

Generate population for data simulation

gen_pop(design_args, n_subj = NULL, fixed_ranges = NULL,
  var_range = c(0, 3), err_range = c(0, 6))

Arguments

design_args

list specifying experimental design (see stim_lists); for best results, n_item should be 2*minimum number of items needed for the design
n_subj

number of subjects (for defining random effects structure; for best results, should be 2*number of stimulus lists
fixed_ranges

list of 2-element vectors (min, max) defining ranges of fixed effect parameters
var_range

2-element vector defining range (min, max) of random effect variances
err_range

2-element vector defining range of error variance

Value

list with parameters for data generation

See also

sim_norm

Examples


dargs <- list(ivs = c(A = 2, B = 2), n_item = 8)
gen_pop(dargs, 8)
#> $fixed
#> (Intercept)          A2          B2       A2:B2 
#>   2.1401918   0.1956483   1.0626204   2.4755983 
#> 
#> $subj_rfx
#>             (Intercept)         A2          B2      A2:B2
#> (Intercept)  1.90939684 -1.2258088  0.09597889  0.1521171
#> A2          -1.22580877  1.4370736 -0.16513874  0.4781659
#> B2           0.09597889 -0.1651387  1.29651377 -1.3198060
#> A2:B2        0.15211706  0.4781659 -1.31980598  2.1193015
#> 
#> $item_rfx
#>             (Intercept)        A2          B2      A2:B2
#> (Intercept)  1.59472062 1.1896595 -0.01136419  0.8764575
#> A2           1.18965948 1.4809110  0.98153066  0.5899103
#> B2          -0.01136419 0.9815307  2.33792588 -0.2303857
#> A2:B2        0.87645749 0.5899103 -0.23038566  0.6125350
#> 
#> $err_var
#> [1] 2.421229
#>
